humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the largest microscopic dimension of the invasive lobular carcinoma as 3.0 cm. Based on the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm, and T4 tumors are of any size with direct extension to the chest wall or skin. Since the tumor size is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, the T stage is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, it is stated that the 'tumor greater than or equal to 2.0-5.0cm' and the 'greatest microscopic dimension' of the tumor is 3.0cm. Therefore, the T stage is T2.
